service: Amazon Lookout for Equipment is a machine learning service that uses advanced analytics to identify anomalies in machines from sensor data for use in predictive maintenance.

operations.CreateDataset: Creates a container for a collection of data being ingested for analysis. The dataset contains the metadata describing where the data is and what the data actually looks like. In other words, it contains the location of the data source, the data schema, and other information. A dataset also contains any tags associated with the ingested data.
operations.CreateInferenceScheduler: Creates a scheduled inference. Scheduling an inference is setting up a continuous real-time inference plan to analyze new measurement data. When setting up the schedule, you provide an S3 bucket location for the input data, assign it a delimiter between separate entries in the data, set an offset delay if desired, and set the frequency of inferencing. You must also provide an S3 bucket location for the output data.
operations.CreateModel:
Creates an ML model for data inference.

A machine-learning (ML) model is a mathematical model that finds patterns in your data. In Amazon Lookout for Equipment, the model learns the patterns of normal behavior and detects abnormal behavior that could be potential equipment failure (or maintenance events). The models are made by analyzing normal data and abnormalities in machine behavior that have already occurred.

Your model is trained using a portion of the data from your dataset and uses that data to learn patterns of normal behavior and abnormal patterns that lead to equipment failure. Another portion of the data is used to evaluate the model's accuracy.
operations.DeleteDataset: Deletes a dataset and associated artifacts. The operation will check to see if any inference scheduler or data ingestion job is currently using the dataset, and if there isn't, the dataset, its metadata, and any associated data stored in S3 will be deleted. This does not affect any models that used this dataset for training and evaluation, but does prevent it from being used in the future.
operations.DeleteInferenceScheduler: Deletes an inference scheduler that has been set up. Already processed output results are not affected.
operations.DeleteModel: Deletes an ML model currently available for Amazon Lookout for Equipment. This will prevent it from being used with an inference scheduler, even one that is already set up.
operations.DescribeDataIngestionJob: Provides information on a specific data ingestion job such as creation time, dataset ARN, status, and so on.
operations.DescribeDataset: Provides information on a specified dataset such as the schema location, status, and so on.
operations.DescribeInferenceScheduler: Specifies information about the inference scheduler being used, including name, model, status, and associated metadata
operations.DescribeModel: Provides overall information about a specific ML model, including model name and ARN, dataset, training and evaluation information, status, and so on.
operations.ListDataIngestionJobs: Provides a list of all data ingestion jobs, including dataset name and ARN, S3 location of the input data, status, and so on.
operations.ListDatasets: Lists all datasets currently available in your account, filtering on the dataset name.
operations.ListInferenceExecutions: Lists all inference executions that have been performed by the specified inference scheduler.
operations.ListInferenceSchedulers: Retrieves a list of all inference schedulers currently available for your account.
operations.ListModels: Generates a list of all models in the account, including model name and ARN, dataset, and status.
operations.ListTagsForResource: Lists all the tags for a specified resource, including key and value.
operations.StartDataIngestionJob: Starts a data ingestion job. Amazon Lookout for Equipment returns the job status.
operations.TagResource: Associates a given tag to a resource in your account. A tag is a key-value pair which can be added to an Amazon Lookout for Equipment resource as metadata. Tags can be used for organizing your resources as well as helping you to search and filter by tag. Multiple tags can be added to a resource, either when you create it, or later. Up to 50 tags can be associated with each resource.
operations.UntagResource: Removes a specific tag from a given resource. The tag is specified by its key.

AccessDeniedException.base: The request could not be completed because you do not have access to the resource.

refs.ListTagsForResourceRequest$ResourceArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource (such as the dataset or model) that is the focus of the ListTagsForResource operation.
refs.TagResourceRequest$ResourceArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the specific resource to which the tag should be associated.
refs.UntagResourceRequest$ResourceArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the resource to which the tag is currently associated.

refs.DescribeDataIngestionJobResponse$FailedR: Specifies the reason for failure when a data ingestion job has failed.
refs.DescribeModelResponse$FailedReason: If the training of the ML model failed, this indicates the reason for that failure.
refs.InferenceExecutionSummary$FailedReason: Specifies the reason for failure when an inference execution has failed.

refs.InferenceInputNameConfiguration$Componen: Indicates the delimiter character used between items in the data.

ConflictException.base: The request could not be completed due to a conflict with the current state of the target resource.

refs.CreateInferenceSchedulerRequest$DataDela: A period of time (in minutes) by which inference on the data is delayed after the data starts. For instance, if you select an offset delay time of five minutes, inference will not begin on the data until the first data measurement after the five minute mark. For example, if five minutes is selected, the inference scheduler will wake up at the configured frequency with the additional five minute delay time to check the customer S3 bucket. The customer can upload data at the same frequency and they don't need to stop and restart the scheduler when uploading new data.
refs.DescribeInferenceSchedulerResponse$DataD: A period of time (in minutes) by which inference on the data is delayed after the data starts. For instance, if you select an offset delay time of five minutes, inference will not begin on the data until the first data measurement after the five minute mark. For example, if five minutes is selected, the inference scheduler will wake up at the configured frequency with the additional five minute delay time to check the customer S3 bucket. The customer can upload data at the same frequency and they don't need to stop and restart the scheduler when uploading new data.
refs.InferenceSchedulerSummary$DataDelayOffse: > A period of time (in minutes) by which inference on the data is delayed after the data starts. For instance, if an offset delay time of five minutes was selected, inference will not begin on the data until the first data measurement after the five minute mark. For example, if five minutes is selected, the inference scheduler will wake up at the configured frequency with the additional five minute delay time to check the customer S3 bucket. The customer can upload data at the same frequency and they don't need to stop and restart the scheduler when uploading new data.
refs.UpdateInferenceSchedulerRequest$DataDela: > A period of time (in minutes) by which inference on the data is delayed after the data starts. For instance, if you select an offset delay time of five minutes, inference will not begin on the data until the first data measurement after the five minute mark. For example, if five minutes is selected, the inference scheduler will wake up at the configured frequency with the additional five minute delay time to check the customer S3 bucket. The customer can upload data at the same frequency and they don't need to stop and restart the scheduler when uploading new data.

refs.ListDataIngestionJobsResponse$DataIngest: Specifies information about the specific data ingestion job, including dataset name and status.

DataIngestionJobSummary.base: Provides information about a specified data ingestion job, including dataset information, data ingestion configuration, and status.

DataPreProcessingConfiguration.base:
The configuration is the TargetSamplingRate, which is the sampling rate of the data after post processing by Amazon Lookout for Equipment. For example, if you provide data that has been collected at a 1 second level and you want the system to resample the data at a 1 minute rate before training, the TargetSamplingRate is 1 minute.

When providing a value for the TargetSamplingRate, you must attach the prefix "PT" to the rate you want. The value for a 1 second rate is therefore PT1S, the value for a 15 minute rate is PT15M, and the value for a 1 hour rate is PT1H

refs.CreateModelRequest$DataPreProcessingConf:
The configuration is the TargetSamplingRate, which is the sampling rate of the data after post processing by Amazon Lookout for Equipment. For example, if you provide data that has been collected at a 1 second level and you want the system to resample the data at a 1 minute rate before training, the TargetSamplingRate is 1 minute.

When providing a value for the TargetSamplingRate, you must attach the prefix "PT" to the rate you want. The value for a 1 second rate is therefore PT1S, the value for a 15 minute rate is PT15M, and the value for a 1 hour rate is PT1H
refs.DescribeModelResponse$DataPreProcessingC:
The configuration is the TargetSamplingRate, which is the sampling rate of the data after post processing by Amazon Lookout for Equipment. For example, if you provide data that has been collected at a 1 second level and you want the system to resample the data at a 1 minute rate before training, the TargetSamplingRate is 1 minute.

When providing a value for the TargetSamplingRate, you must attach the prefix "PT" to the rate you want. The value for a 1 second rate is therefore PT1S, the value for a 15 minute rate is PT15M, and the value for a 1 hour rate is PT1H

refs.CreateInferenceSchedulerRequest$DataUplo: How often data is uploaded to the source S3 bucket for the input data. The value chosen is the length of time between data uploads. For instance, if you select 5 minutes, Amazon Lookout for Equipment will upload the real-time data to the source bucket once every 5 minutes. This frequency also determines how often Amazon Lookout for Equipment starts a scheduled inference on your data. In this example, it starts once every 5 minutes.
refs.DescribeInferenceSchedulerResponse$DataU: Specifies how often data is uploaded to the source S3 bucket for the input data. This value is the length of time between data uploads. For instance, if you select 5 minutes, Amazon Lookout for Equipment will upload the real-time data to the source bucket once every 5 minutes. This frequency also determines how often Amazon Lookout for Equipment starts a scheduled inference on your data. In this example, it starts once every 5 minutes.
refs.InferenceSchedulerSummary$DataUploadFreq: How often data is uploaded to the source S3 bucket for the input data. This value is the length of time between data uploads. For instance, if you select 5 minutes, Amazon Lookout for Equipment will upload the real-time data to the source bucket once every 5 minutes. This frequency also determines how often Amazon Lookout for Equipment starts a scheduled inference on your data. In this example, it starts once every 5 minutes.
refs.UpdateInferenceSchedulerRequest$DataUplo: How often data is uploaded to the source S3 bucket for the input data. The value chosen is the length of time between data uploads. For instance, if you select 5 minutes, Amazon Lookout for Equipment will upload the real-time data to the source bucket once every 5 minutes. This frequency also determines how often Amazon Lookout for Equipment starts a scheduled inference on your data. In this example, it starts once every 5 minutes.

refs.CreateInferenceSchedulerRequest$Tags: Any tags associated with the inference scheduler.
refs.CreateModelRequest$Tags: Any tags associated with the ML model being created.
refs.ListTagsForResourceResponse$Tags: Any tags associated with the resource.
refs.TagResourceRequest$Tags: The tag or tags to be associated with a specific resource. Both the tag key and value are specified.

refs.DataPreProcessingConfiguration$TargetSam:
The sampling rate of the data after post processing by Amazon Lookout for Equipment. For example, if you provide data that has been collected at a 1 second level and you want the system to resample the data at a 1 minute rate before training, the TargetSamplingRate is 1 minute.

When providing a value for the TargetSamplingRate, you must attach the prefix "PT" to the rate you want. The value for a 1 second rate is therefore PT1S, the value for a 15 minute rate is PT15M, and the value for a 1 hour rate is PT1H

ThrottlingException.base: The request was denied due to request throttling.

refs.InferenceInputConfiguration$InputTimeZon: Indicates the difference between your time zone and Greenwich Mean Time (GMT).

refs.CreateModelRequest$TrainingDataStartTime: Indicates the time reference in the dataset that should be used to begin the subset of training data for the ML model.
refs.CreateModelRequest$TrainingDataEndTime: Indicates the time reference in the dataset that should be used to end the subset of training data for the ML model.
refs.CreateModelRequest$EvaluationDataStartTi: Indicates the time reference in the dataset that should be used to begin the subset of evaluation data for the ML model.
refs.CreateModelRequest$EvaluationDataEndTime: Indicates the time reference in the dataset that should be used to end the subset of evaluation data for the ML model.
refs.DatasetSummary$CreatedAt: The time at which the dataset was created in Amazon Lookout for Equipment.
refs.DescribeDataIngestionJobResponse$Created: The time at which the data ingestion job was created.
refs.DescribeDatasetResponse$CreatedAt: Specifies the time the dataset was created in Amazon Lookout for Equipment.
refs.DescribeDatasetResponse$LastUpdatedAt: Specifies the time the dataset was last updated, if it was.
refs.DescribeInferenceSchedulerResponse$Creat: Specifies the time at which the inference scheduler was created.
refs.DescribeInferenceSchedulerResponse$Updat: Specifies the time at which the inference scheduler was last updated, if it was.
refs.DescribeModelResponse$TrainingDataStartT: Indicates the time reference in the dataset that was used to begin the subset of training data for the ML model.
refs.DescribeModelResponse$TrainingDataEndTim: Indicates the time reference in the dataset that was used to end the subset of training data for the ML model.
refs.DescribeModelResponse$EvaluationDataStar: Indicates the time reference in the dataset that was used to begin the subset of evaluation data for the ML model.
refs.DescribeModelResponse$EvaluationDataEndT: Indicates the time reference in the dataset that was used to end the subset of evaluation data for the ML model.
refs.DescribeModelResponse$TrainingExecutionS: Indicates the time at which the training of the ML model began.
refs.DescribeModelResponse$TrainingExecutionE: Indicates the time at which the training of the ML model was completed.
refs.DescribeModelResponse$LastUpdatedTime: Indicates the last time the ML model was updated. The type of update is not specified.
refs.DescribeModelResponse$CreatedAt: Indicates the time and date at which the ML model was created.
refs.InferenceExecutionSummary$ScheduledStart: Indicates the start time at which the inference scheduler began the specific inference execution.
refs.InferenceExecutionSummary$DataStartTime: Indicates the time reference in the dataset at which the inference execution began.
refs.InferenceExecutionSummary$DataEndTime: Indicates the time reference in the dataset at which the inference execution stopped.
refs.ListInferenceExecutionsRequest$DataStart: The time reference in the inferenced dataset after which Amazon Lookout for Equipment started the inference execution.
refs.ListInferenceExecutionsRequest$DataEndTi: The time reference in the inferenced dataset before which Amazon Lookout for Equipment stopped the inference execution.
refs.ModelSummary$CreatedAt: The time at which the specific model was created.

ValidationException.base: The input fails to satisfy constraints specified by Amazon Lookout for Equipment or a related AWS service that's being utilized.
